net.floodlightcontroller.util

Class GroupUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.floodlightcontroller.util.GroupUtils

  • public class GroupUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Convert OFGroups to and from JSON strings. Used primarily by the static flow pusher to store and retrieve flow entries.
    Author:
    Ryan Izard

      • groupBucketsToJsonArray

        public static void groupBucketsToJsonArray(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator jsonGen,
                                           java.util.List<org.projectfloodlight.openflow.protocol.OFBucket> bucketList)
        Append an array of buckets to an existing JsonGenerator. This method assumes the field name of the array has been written already, if required. The appended data will be formatted as follows: [ { bucket-1 }, { bucket-2 }, ..., { bucket-n } ]
        Parameters:
        jsonGen -
        bucketList -

      • groupBucketsToJsonArray

        public static java.lang.String groupBucketsToJsonArray(java.util.List<org.projectfloodlight.openflow.protocol.OFBucket> bucketList)
        Convert a list of group buckets into a JSON-formatted string. The string data will be formatted as follows: [ { bucket-1 }, { bucket-2 }, ..., { bucket-n } ]
        Parameters:
        bucketList -
        Returns:
        the string, formatted as described above

      • setGroupBucketsFromJsonArray

        public static boolean setGroupBucketsFromJsonArray(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.protocol.OFGroupMod.Builder g,
                                                   java.lang.String json)
        Convert a JSON-formatted string of group buckets to a Java list of buckets. The JSON format expected is: [ { bucket-1 }, { bucket-2 }, ..., { bucket-n } ]
        Parameters:
        g - the group-mod message to add the buckets
        json - the string, formatted as described above
